name: HTTP Request: Add Row to Sheet

Set Request: Get Workspaces
INDEX.HTML
template:
Crane & Hoist Monthly Inspection Checklist

1. Are functional operating mechanisms in acceptable condition from excessive wear?
2. Are functional operating mechanisms aligned properly?
a) Check hoist movement on trolley
b) Test vertical movement of hook on the hoist
3. Are any mechanisms visibly deteriorating?
4. List all hooks inspected:
Hoist S/N if known Visible Cracks? Throat opening larger than normal? Twisted? Action
5. If applicable, do all slings and straps have serial numbers and load capacities legible? (If "N/A" skip to 8)
a) Do any slings or straps have frayed edges? (If "Y", please discard)
b) Do any slings ou straps have tape wrapped around it? (If "Y", please discard)
6. If applicable, do any lifting fixtures or below the hook lifting devices have legible serial numbers and load limits? (If "N/A" Skip to 8, If no contact EHS)
a) Do any of the fixtures have cracks ou bends? (If "Y", please discard)
b) Do any of the fixtures have excessive wear? (If "Y", please discard)
c) Do any of the fixtures have deformation? (If "Y", please discard)
7. If applicable, do below the hook wire ropes ou cables have a serial number ou other identifier? (If "Y" answer questions below, If "N" contact EHS)
a) Do any of the ropes have reduction to the diameter? (If "Y", please discard)
b) Do any of the ropes have broken, worn, ou corroded wires? (If "Y", please discard)
c) Do any of the ropes have severe kinking, crushing, cutting ou becoming unstrung? (If "Y", please discard)
8. Were there any defects, deficiencies ou problems that constitute a safety hazard? (If "Y", contact EHS)

template:
Crane & Hoist Monthly Inspection Checklist

1. Are functional operating mechanisms in acceptable condition from excessive wear?
2. Are functional operating mechanisms aligned properly?
a) Check hoist movement on trolley
b) Test vertical movement of hook on the hoist
3. Are any mechanisms visibly deteriorating?
4. List all hooks inspected:
Hoist S/N if known Visible Cracks? Throat opening larger than normal? Twisted? Action
5. If applicable, do all slings and straps have serial numbers and load capacities legible? (If "N/A" skip to 8)
a) Do any slings or straps have frayed edges? (If "Y", please discard)
b) Do any slings ou straps have tape wrapped around it? (If "Y", please discard)
6. If applicable, do any lifting fixtures or below the hook lifting devices have legible serial numbers and load limits? (If "N/A" Skip to 8, If no contact EHS)
a) Do any of the fixtures have cracks ou bends? (If "Y", please discard)

c) Do any of the fixtures have deformation? (If "Y", please discard)
7. If applicable, do below the hook wire ropes ou cables have a serial number ou other identifier? (If "Y" answer questions below, If "N" contact EHS)

b) Do any of the ropes have broken, worn, ou corroded wires? (If "Y", please discard)

b) Test vertical movement of hook on the hoist
3. Are any mechanisms visibly deteriorating?
4. List all hooks inspected:
Hoist S/N if known Visible Cracks? Throat opening larger than normal? Twisted?
5. If applicable, do all slings and straps have serial numbers and load capacities legible? (If "N/A" skip to 8)

b) Do any slings or straps have tape wrapped around it? (If "Y", please discard)

name: Set Fail Coil
func:
msg.payload = { value: true, address: 'fail_address' }; // Ajuste o endereo do coil 'fail_address'
return msg;
